item.title: Report X-2024050929
item.description:
Report X-2024050929

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: LANSING
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE BLOCKS COOLING ICE CREAM. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024050911
item.description:
Report X-2024050911

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (1) 500 ML BOTTLE OF FLAMMABLE GYEON Q2M TAR SLIGHTLY LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THERMAL TRACKING LABEL DESCRIBES THE CONTENTS AS CLEANING AGENT. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 06521W, AMAZON.COM.KYDC, INC., 125 BUSINESS BLVD, CLEAR BROOK VA 22624-1568.

item.title: Report E-2024050628
item.description:
Report E-2024050628

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: WARREN
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1-pound of Azodicarbonamide was released from one 52-pound fiber box due to damage at the corner of the container, likely damaged during loading. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will sweep up the spilled contents and place them into a 20-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024050084
item.description:
Report I-2024050084

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: Detroit
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was scheduled to deliver a shipment of Ferric Chloride to EQ Detroit. The driver arrived on site and was asked to deliver into tank#2 on site. During the offload the gauging system wasn't functioning properly which resulted in approximately 10 gallons of Ferric Chloride to be released on site in containment. C

item.title: Report E-2024050617
item.description:
Report E-2024050617

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-29T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: MARSHALL
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SET Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor, 20ft-by-8ft area of the asphalt lot and estimated that twelve (12) gallons of material was released due to a puncture in one (1) 220-gallon poly tote. SET Environmental personnel deployed a neutralizer and then granular absorbents to the impacted area. The spent material was gathered and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged tote was cut-up and placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
